author: {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'BSE Notices'}
headline: SRS's board meeting on November 14, 2017
description: Intimation of Board Meeting.
articleBody: At 13:52 hrs SRS was quoting at Rs 2.70, down Rs 0.03, or 1.10 percent.  The share touched its 52-week high Rs 8.25 and 52-week low Rs 2.33 on 30 January, 2017 and 06 June, 2017, respectively.    Currently, it is trading 67.27 percent below its 52-week high and 15.88 percent above its 52-week low.    Market capitalisation stands at Rs 75.22 crore.  Source : BSE

author: {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Faizan Javed'}
headline: SRS in talks to sell cinema business
description: &quot;Due to liquidity issues, the company had decided to sell the 'Cinemas' and 'Retail' divisions of the company,&quot; SRS Ltd said in a regulatory filing.
articleBody: Facing &quot;liquidity issues&quot;, diversified company SRS Ltd today said it is in talks with multiplex operators including INOX and private equity players to sell its cinema business. &quot;Due to liquidity issues, the company had decided to sell the 'Cinemas' and 'Retail' divisions of the company,&quot; SRS Ltd said in a regulatory filing. &quot;The Expression of Interest (EOI) for cinema division has been received by few players of the cinema exhibition business and private equity, including INOX, however, financial bids are yet to be received,&quot; it said. SRS Cinemas operates over 50 screens in over 15 cities in the country. SRS Ltd stock was trading nearly 20 percent up at Rs 6.33 in the afternoon trade on BSE.

author: {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'webtech_news18'}
headline: SRS Q2 net loss at Rs 20.22cr
description: The company had clocked a net profit of Rs 14.24 crore in the same period last year, the company said in a BSE filing.
articleBody: Diversified company SRS Ltd today posted a standalone net loss of Rs 20.22 crore in the second quarter of this fiscal due to sluggish sales. The company had clocked a net profit of Rs 14.24 crore in the same period last year, the company said in a BSE filing. The company's income during the second quarter of the fiscal declined sharply to Rs 155.77 crore from 1,093.26 crore in the year-ago period. The company posted losses in its gold and jewellery as well as retail segments during the quarter.

headline: SRS subsidiary to set up 5 screen multiplex at Bareilly
description: SRS Ltd has informed BSE that SRS Entertainment India Limited (Formerly known as SRS Entertainment Limited), a wholly-owned subsidiary Company, has signed up for setting up of 5 screen multiplex at Bareilly with seating capacity of 1126 seats.
articleBody: SRS Ltd has informed BSE that SRS Entertainment India Limited (Formerly known as SRS Entertainment Limited), a wholly-owned subsidiary Company, has signed up for setting up of 5 screen multiplex at Bareilly with seating capacity of 1126 seats.Presently, the Company operates 62 screens with total capacity of 16099 Seats across 17 cities with 22 properties.Source : BSE Read all announcements in SRS

headline: SRS appoints Praveen Kumar Kapoor as director
description: SRS Ltd has informed BSE that the Board of Directors of the Company at its meeting held on January 19, 2016, has approved the appointment of Sh. Praveen Kumar Kapoor as Non-Executive Director of the Company with immediate effect.
articleBody: SRS Ltd has informed BSE that the Board of Directors of the Company at its meeting held on January 19, 2016, inter alia, has noted resignation of Sh. Ankit Garg, Non-Executive Director from the directorship of the Company due to other pre-occupations and approved the appointment of Sh. Praveen Kumar Kapoor as Non-Executive Director of the Company with immediate effect.Source : BSE Read all announcements in SRS

author: {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Faizan Javed'}
headline: SRS Group plans to open around 300 stores in next 5-7 yrs
description: SRS Health, the business vertical of SRS Group, plans to open around 25-30 outlets to start off with, in the next 3-4 months, in the Delhi-NCR region. The medicine stores would be opened under the 'SRS Pharmacy' brand.
articleBody: SRS Group, which is foraying into the pharmacy segment, plans to open around 300 drug stores over the next three to five years in the country. SRS Health, the business vertical of SRS Group, plans to open around 25-30 outlets to start off with, in the next 3-4 months, in the Delhi-NCR region. The medicine stores would be opened under the 'SRS Pharmacy' brand.  &quot;We plan to open 25-30 odd stores in the next 3-4 months and test the waters. Our long term goal is to open 100 stores each year for the next three years,&quot; SRS Group President and Chief Strategy Officer Tinku Singh told agency. The company would first establish its presence in the Delhi-NCR region, before opening stores in other parts of the country, he added.  When asked about the investment, Singh said on an average, 25 pharmacies would entail an outlay of around Rs 5-7 crore. &quot;We have forayed into the sector actively to make an impact in the healthcare landscape of the country,&quot; said Anil Jindal, Chairman, SRS Group. The company is emphasising on delivering exclusive healthcare services along with quality controlled medicines and drugs, he added.  The Delhi-based group is already engaged in production of surgical equipments and consumables such as syringes, auto-disable syringes, hypodermic needles scalp vein sets, infusion sets, among others. With a turnover of over Rs 6,000 crore, SRS Group has presence across various segments, including retail, real estate, hospitality and education, among others.
tags: Anil Jindal, Business, Chairman, healthcare services, NCR, Real Estate, SRS, SRS Group, Tinku Singh

author: {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Faizan Javed'}
headline: SRS to invest up to Rs 900 cr in 2 yrs for expansion
description: The firm plans to open 30 SRS Pharmacy stores this fiscal.
articleBody: SRS Ltd will invest up to Rs 900 crore in the next two years to expand retail network of its various consumer centric businesses such as hospitality, cinema, jewellery and real estate. &quot;We will invest between Rs 700-900 crore in the next two years to expand retail network of our various businesses. We are also foraying into the pharmacy business with the launch of our first store 'SRS Pharmacy' next week,&quot; SRS Ltd Group President and Chief Strategy Officer Tinku Singh told agency. The firm plans to open 30 SRS Pharmacy stores this fiscal. &quot;Our plan it to open 100 pharmacy stores every year. We have all the approval in place. We are testing the waters. We will also launch online pharmacy portal next month,&quot; SRS E-retail Ltd Managing Director Pratik Jindal said. Singh added that the company has drawn an aggressive expansion plan to increase its footprints across business verticals. &quot;We will fund up to Rs 900 crore investment through a mix of internal accruals and debt,&quot; he added. SRS Ltd, which reported a turnover of Rs 3,824.84 crore in the previous fiscal, has presence across various sectors such as retail, hospitality, real estate, cinemas and jewellery.
tags: Business, online pharmacy portal, Pratik Jindal, President and Chief Strategy Officer, Real Estate, Retail, SRS, SRS Ltd, SRS Ltd Group, Tinku Singh
